unnormalised: NH44, India's longest highway, stretches ~3745 km from Srinagar to Kanyakumari. It connects 11 states and is vital for inter-state commerce & tourism. Did you know it used to be known by different number segments before being unified in 2010?
normalised: N-H-fourty four, India's longest highway, stretches approximately three thousand seven hundred and fourty five kilometer from Srinagar to Kanyakumari. It connects eleven states and is vital for inter-state commerce and tourism. Did you know it used to be known by different number segments before being unified in two thousand and ten?

unnormalised: Traveling by road offers a unique perspective. Routes like the Golden Quadrilateral connecting Delhi, Kolkata, Chennai & Mumbai (approx. 5846 km) have drastically improved travel times. However, always check road conditions & advisories before starting your journey. Monsoon season often causes delays.

unnormalised: For those planning road trips, understanding highway classifications is crucial. National Highways (NH) are maintained by the central govt, while State Highways (SH) fall under the purview of respective state governments. Toll taxes vary depending on the vehicle type and distance covered. FASTag is now mandatory on most routes.
normalised: For those planning road trips, understanding highway classifications is crucial. National Highways (N-H) are maintained by the central government, while State Highways (S-H) fall under the purview of respective state governments. Toll taxes vary depending on the vehicle type and distance covered. F-A-S-T-ag is now mandatory on most routes.

unnormalised: Thinking of a budget? Keep in mind fuel prices fluctuate; diesel is usually cheaper than petrol. Tolls on the Delhi-Jaipur highway can cost around ₹500-₹700 for a car. Plus, food at dhabas along the way is a must-try experience, averaging about Rs. 200 per person.
normalised: Thinking of a budget? Keep in mind fuel prices fluctuate; diesel is usually cheaper than petrol. Tolls on the Delhi-Jaipur highway can cost around rupee five hundred to rupee seven hundred for a car. Plus, food at dhabas along the way is a must-try experience, averaging about rupees two hundred per person.

unnormalised: Remember that driving licenses and vehicle registration are essential. Also, familiarize yourself with local traffic rules. Safety first! Carrying a first-aid kit and ensuring your vehicle is in top condition are non-negotiable, especially for long routes like the one from Bangalore to Ladakh (2060 km approximately).
